sndlib.core.util
Class DoubleFormat

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.util.DoubleFormat

public class DoubleFormat
extends java.lang.Object

This class encapsulates the common format for double numbers in SNDlib.

Author:
Roman Klaehne

Method Summary
static java.lang.String formatLong(double value)
          Returns a long, more exactly string representation (i.e. with six fraction digits) of the given double value.
static java.lang.String formatShort(double value)
          Returns a short string representation (i.e. with exactly two fraction digits) of the given double value.
static java.lang.String formatShortToMinimumFractionDigits(double value)
          Returns a short string representation (i.e. with a maximum of two fraction digits) of the given double value.
static double parse(java.lang.String value)
          Parses the given string into a double number by applying the common double format.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

parse

public static double parse(java.lang.String value)
                    throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
Parses the given string into a double number by applying the common double format.

Parameters:
value - the string to parse into a double value
Returns:
the parsed double value
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the given string cannot be parsed into a double value
